title.rendered: The View Announces New Cast (Including a Very Familar Face)!

content.rendered:
Reading Time: < 1 minute

Hey! Look who is set to enjoy The View once again!

ABC has confirmed the full panel for Season 19 of this ever-changing talk show, with Joy Behar officially on board to return as a full-time host.

The comedian will be joined at the table by returning stars Whoopi Goldberg, Michelle Collins and Raven-Symoné.

Newcomers, meanwhile, will iclude Paula Faris of ABC News and Full House actress Candace Cameron Bure, who famously clashed with Raven-Symoné over gay wedding cakes earlier this summer.

"As The View embarks on a remarkable 19th season, I am extremely proud to see the legacy of smart and diverse women engaging in entertaining and thought-provoking conversation continue," Barbara Walters, creator and executive producer, said via statement.

The program, of course, has undergone countless cast evolutions over recent years.

Rosie O’Donnell was around for a year. Then, she left. Then, she returned. Then, she left again.

Sherri Shepherd and Jenny McCarthy were shown the door last year and then Rosie Perez lasted for just a few months as a regular.

In addition to the aforementioned full-time hosts, The View will feature a rotating team of contributors that includes Shepherd, Top Chef’s Padma Lakshmi, What Not to Wear veteran Stacy London, Ana Navarro and actress-model Molly Sims.

They all sound well and good… but here’s a look at who we’d have chosen to appear everyday on The View:

11 Stars We’d Love to See Host The View

VIEW GALLERY
